pageTitle: Bachelor of Science in Electrical Engineering | Penn State Harrisburg
title: Degrees Awarded, by Semester
textBeforeTable: Program Enrollment and Graduation Statistics Electrical Engineering graduates are encouraged to continue their professional development by taking the Fundamentals of Engineering Examination at the end of their senior year; the FE exam is a prerequisite for taking the Professional Engineering Examination. This program is accredited by the Engineering Accreditation Commission of ABET, www.abet.org. Visit ABET for more information on accreditation, including the reasons that an ABET-accredited program is the right choice for the engineering professional. Accreditation and Licensure VLSI Power systems Microprocessors, Computer Networking, & Computer Engineering Electronics and Signal Processing Control Systems and Robotics Communications, Microwave, & Wireless Systems Areas of Concentration The Bachelor of Science degree in Electrical Engineering is designed to provide a solid background in electrical engineering sciences. It also provides an opportunity for students to pursue interests in electrical and electronic circuits, including digital circuits and VLSI and its fabrication, microprocessors and their applications, electromagnetics, communications, control systems, and digital image processing and computer vision. Through a senior capstone design project, the curriculum emphasizes written as well as verbal communication and a teamwork approach among students to attain a common goal. Deb Miller Administrative Support Assistant Sedig S. Agili, Ph.D. Program Coordinator
